intro: Selinum austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian selinum, is a perennial herb native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with small white or greenish flowers that appear in umbels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
